io.github.cantido.qlearner.agent

Class Agent

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.cantido.qlearner.agent.Agent

  • @NotThreadSafe
public class Agent
extends Object
    Performs Actions that will lead to changes in the Environment 's current State.

    This is the object that will navigate and learn the problem space (the Environment). It implements the Q-learning algorithm to pick the optimal Action to take while in each State in order to maximize the accumulated Reward value.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Remove recent history from this object, so that it does not associate the next State with the previous Step.

        Use this when you plan to "move" this agent. For instance, if you move this agent from a goal state back to a start state, call this method before your Environment returns your next State, so that this agent does not think it can take one step to transition to that starting state.

      • takeNextAction

        public void takeNextAction()
        Determine the next Action to take, and then call its Runnable.run() method.

        This Agent will also update the Quality value of the previous State and the Action that got us from there to here, based on the current State's reward value.

      • getLastStep

        public Optional<Step> getLastStep()
        Get the most recent Step made by this Agent.

        If this agent has not yet executed any Action, there will be no Step to return.

        Returns:
        the most recent Step taken by this object.

      • await

        public void await()
           throws InterruptedException,
                  ExecutionException
        Wait for the last executed Action to complete. Calling this method is optional. If the Actions taken by this Agent will happen in another thread, and the caller needs that thread to complete before the next call to takeNextAction(), then you can use this method to block until the most recently-taken Action completes.

        If you are using the default ExecutorService provided by AgentBuilder, then calling this method does nothing: AgentBuilder's default ExecutorService runs Actions in the same thread as this Agent. 

         while(true) {
     agent.takeNextAction(); // This may run your Action in a new thread.
     agent.await();          // This will block until that thread completes.
 }
        Throws:
        CancellationException - if the Action was cancelled
        ExecutionException - if the Action threw an exception
        InterruptedException - if the current thread was interrupted while waiting
